comment: Nightmare online, would describe her grading as cruel and unusual. Uses ALEKS but has ZERO multiple choice questions. Just an annoying class in general
Incredibly strict on grading and due dates, absolutely no understanding, never taken her in person, but online was a total nightmare. Her grading I would literally describe as cruel and unusual

I'm sure this professor is fine to take in person but online it's hell. She will dock 20 points on a test (worth 75% of your overall grade) just for a simple accident on environmental checks. Also just heavy homework on AKLES you just gotta teach yourself everything. Don't take if you struggle in math
good, lots of online work

Do not take this class if you have other classes with a heavy workload. This one class had more homework than my chemistry class which is insane. Its drop add week and I've already done about 35 seperate units of HW on Aleks, each being 5 questions each. We started class less than a week ago.

As someone who hated school because I from a low income areas with teacher that were so done with students.

My grades might not be the best, but I can tell for the first time a teacher want me to successful.

that's one hell of a motivation, and guess what? I like math now!!

 So if you got a background like mine, you'll find the value too

Mrs.Schnakenburg is by FAR the best math teacher I have ever had.I have never been good at math.However, Mrs.Schnakenburg made this class easy to follow. She cares about her students, and wants to make sure you understand. You have to put in the work, go to class, take notes, participate, do your HW.If I could have her every math class I would.

An amazing professor if you struggle with math. I passed with an A, when I usually have C's in other math classes. Likes to teach the basics before teaching the actual material which made it 10x easier to understand. I was also in her support class and all we did was work on homework but she was always there to help if you were struggling.

I took this course over the summer, 100% online. Has zoom tutoring sessions before exam day where she goes over questions you can't solve easily on the study guide and solves it with you explaining the steps. Highly recommend attending this is how I passed with an A. The exam study guide content is very similar to the actual exam content.
Professor Schnakenburg gives great lectures and teaches to make sure you have a clear understanding of the material. You will enjoy this class and learn a lot.

Great teacher! Shes super nice and always wants to help you understand. Homework isnt crazy its just the courses required homework on aleks so every class will have the same. She does count attendance for a grade but as long as you do the homework (its all for completion) youll be good. I dont really do well in math but i have an A+ all semester.
Hated this professor. So tough on those environmental checks on ALEKS. For no reason docs so many points off for fun. Never listening to these reviews again.

I took this as a summer class because I changed majors and needed to complete a math course to meet prerequisites. I thought it would be manageable, but I was seriously mistaken. Balancing this course with work has been extremely challenging. I regret investing two months in this course because I might have to retake it in the fall semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Her ratings are really good so it might just be because it was an online summer class, but she did no real lectures and it was just ALEKS 20, 2-4 min videos back to back for each module. Hard to understand. So if you are going to take her for summer, just beware. But gives extra credit and helpful with deadline reminders and communication.

Professor Schnakenburg is the best professor I have ever had. She is very nice and she does give extra credit. She does breakdown the material peace by peace so I could understand. I would definitely take her again

she is so nice and a great teacher. she explains content i never understood in highschool in ways that made sense for me. there is homework after every class, and some of the modules have more than ten topics. basically, stay on top of your work. she gives exam prep as well, and that counts for extra credit. put in the effort and you should be fine

If Algebra hadn't been required I wouldn't have taken it.  And I wouldn't have passed except for all the extra help given me by Prof Schnakenburg.  She was patient, and clear in her explanations.  Made herself available when I needed extra help.  At the end of the class I was amazed at what I had learned.

TAKE THIS CLASS. I've always struggled with math but taking Prof Schnakenburg helped me so much. She gives so many opportunities for extra credit and truly wants all of her students to succeed. Was a lot of homework on ALEKS but if you stay on top of it, it won't be bad.

I absolutely loved taking this class with Cathy. Algebra is truly a hard subject to teach and she does a wonderful job at it. She is accessible outside of class and truly cares about her students' educational and physical well-being. ALEKS is a big part of this course and she allows one-sided notecards on tests.

She is such a great professor. She is super accessible outside of class if you are struggling with anything. There are so many extra credit opportunities and you can use a written notecard on all of the tests. Make sure you stay on top of homework and notes!

Easy A just go to class even though its not mandatory attendance. A lot of extra credit in bonus and reviews. Just don't slack off and take notes. She also is accessible after hours and provides a lot of helpful learning material. She also will tell you what will and what won't be on tests and let you use a handwritten notecard for tests.

Cathy was definitely the best professor i have ever had. She truly cares about you and will give you many opportunities to receive a good grade. Amazing at explaining everything ad makes the lectures interesting. For tests you can have one side of a notecard, which is quite helpful.

She is the best! If math has never been your thing, take her. She breaks down every unit and helps everyone understand the content. She is very attentive and will ask the class to do problems on your own so she can walk around and help. She gives out homework every week thru ALEKS and it is a huge part of your grade so you have to do it.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I love this professor!!! She is one of my favorites. This class is built by weekly homework on ALEKS, 4 tests, and a final exam. She offers a few extra credit opportunities. If you need help, she is more than willing to help out during her office hours and she is really reachable by email. Take this professor. You won't regret it!!
Such a nice and caring person. She is very helpful, and her going to her office hours is so beneficial. We took 4 tests, a final, and had weekly homework in Aleks.

PLEASE TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! She presents material so clearly that it's easy to understand. You are expected to do homework every day, and there are four tests total (in-person). The final is cumulative. She offers tons of extra credit and help outside of class. Cathy genuinely cares for her students and wants everyone to succeed.

She definitely cares about her students. She'll learn your name, gives out tons of extra credit on tests and in ALEKS. If you show up, put in the work, and pay attention, you'll get over an A. She's very kind and the way she teaches honestly makes her one of the best math professors I've ever had. If I could take her again, I definitely would.

I love her! This is a very easy class if you just do the work. She explains everything in detail and makes sure you understand with multiple examples. She uses Aleks for every unit to make sure that you understand outside of class as well. Also offers extra credit and help with office hours.

I am currently taking Precalc with another friendly, loving,  5/5 rated teacher called Miss Bridgette Puckett and before her i took cathy for College Algebra. She is if not one of the most wonderful and caring professor i have ever met. We do get a good amount of homework, but they will really help you in the future.

For MATH 1111 there WILL be a lot of work but there is also a lot to cover. I took online during the 8 week summer semester and as long as you do the work and don't cheat on homework it should all make sense to you. MAKE SURE YOU DO THE OPTIONAL PRACTICE TESTS.
She is also very reasonable and flexible. If you have an issue just email her.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Y'all I promise I stopped understanding math in 7th grade. Ms. Cathy was the best math teacher I've had in years. She knows how to teach in a way everyone can understand. She's accessible out of class and is very helpful. There is a lot of online homework though. She offers Extra credit if you have a 75%+ avg in homework. Take her class. I swear.

Overall a wonderful teacher. She does give a lot of hw but gives you a week or more to do it. Her lectures made the math make sense. She wants you to pass so don't be afraid to ask for help. Lots of extra credit you can take advantage of.

I really enjoyed taking this course. Hands down I would have to say profCathy was the best math I've ever had. She makes class lectures fun and takes the time to make sure everyone understands the concepts She also will help you individually during class and will follow up with you to make sure you don't fall behind. This class is homework heavy.

I loved Mrs. Schnackenburg, she was the reason I know me and a lot of my friends passed algebra. Her class is set up using aleks which i dont mind, you just have to keep up with the deadlines. However she offers a lot of help and office hours. We had 3 tests and the final and all the test reviews were extra credit.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Schnakenburg besides being brilliant and super knowledgable of her stuff is one of the most caring individuals I've since come across in my college career. I experienced an unexpected health issue coming down to the end of the semester and she was absolutely great about checking in and working with me to stay on track to pass her class.

I wish I could take all of my courses with Professor Schnakenburg. The class is fair but if she sees you putting in the effort, she is extremely understanding and willing to work with you. There are a lot of hw assignments and there are 4 exams, but she gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. If youre in class, youll pass. Amazing prof!

She was the best prof. ive ever had. As long as you come to class and literally just listen you will do fine. Aleks is annoying but honestly if you try on the knowledge checks you wont have as much work to do later. 1000000% reccomend her.

Cathy is the best prof I have ever had. She works with you when you dont understand. USE HER OFFICE HOURS! She uses Aleks and will change due dates if you have a real reason for her to. Shell help you if you need to get rounded up at the end of the semester. She lets you use a notecard for each class. Shell say whats not on the test. TAKE HER!

Mrs. Cathy is amazing. I would not have passed Algebra without her. If you care about her class she will help you! Utilize her office hours and put in the effort. She is a very kind and caring teacher and cares about how you do inside of school and outside of school. I wish I could have her again because I am no bueno at math, TAKE HER!!!
Each week there is homework due on ALEKS. Do that each week and you will do fine. She is very helpful and wants you to succeed. You get a calculator and one sided notecard for each test.

Professor Schnakenburg is my homegirl. I loved her class. She is clear and concise in her instructions and answers emails really fast. Plus she gives such good feedback on homework and discussions. This class is kinda hard, but she made it so much easier.

I liked this class a lot since it wasnt hard content and she goes through content very well. Only thing is there is a lot of homework and she doesnt let you make up missed assignments, and she can be a bit slow going through material. But on tests she will give you as much points possible so you wont do bad.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lots of homework

comment: She failed me bc I missed the first week due to a personal issue! BE AWARE she does not care about your personal matters and will not give grace in situations. I asked her if I could retake quizzes not based on math like the syllabus quiz and an assignment like screenshotting my ALEKS registration (even though i registered) she would not.

I don't know where to begin. Cathy was amazing! New to Mercer and very good at what she does. Professional, very helpful, organized, positive, the list goes on. There is no other professor I would take for any Math related class. Great notes. Zoom classes were engaging. Very passionate about her job. I wish there were more Professors like her!

Only reason I had to give a 4/5 was because of the amount of homework, Prof. Schnakenburg herself is literally the best, she genuinely wants to help you understand the material. SUPER homework heavy, so make sure you keep up with it all, but if you dont understand something Prof. Schnakenburg will go out of her way to answer your questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: One of the most challenging classes I have taken BUT she is an amazing professor and person (btw I struggle w/math). If you go to office hours she is so willing to help. Reply's quickly, VERY understanding. The class is a lot of work but I COULD NOT HAVE ASKED FOR A BETTER PROFESSOR. Don't be lazy, communicate, use all resources, you'll do great!!

If you take her class, let it be the only class that you're taking that semester. Each unit you'll have a chapter of homework due (the homework covers 13-19 topics) each week. The last week of the unit you'll have a chapter of homework, a practice test, a THOROUGH discussion post, and a test due. I've never so defeated while taking a math class.

Dr. Schnakenburg made this class very easy! I was concerned about her since it was her first semester at KSU but now I can't imagine having taken this class with another professor. Even though we are remote due to covid, she was always available and gave feedback on every single assignment! Very caring and strongly recommend her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT
